data.title: 24 Best Swimsuit Brands of 2024—Shop Our Definitive List
data.meta_description: Planning a getaway to somewhere warm? Get to know the 24 best swimsuit brands on our radar this year.
data.text:
All products featured on Vogue are independently selected by our editors. However, we may earn affiliate revenue on this article and commission when you buy something.

A search for the best swimsuit brands could leave you drowning in a sea of options. But this year, the quest for beach and poolside excellence will be easier. Ahead, you’ll unearth the labels that made it to our list of the absolute best. Some of the designers on our roster of favorites have been creating swimwear for years, like Eres and Lisa Marie Fernandez, while others are notable emerging brands that deserve a closer look. Now is the time to add Louisa Ballou, Matteau, and Oséree to your swimwear lexicon—they are all creating innovative styles with an impeccable fit for all shapes and sizes, from sleek one-piece designs to elaborate bikinis.

Picks From Our Favorite Swimsuit Brands

The Affordable Favorite: Tropic of C Equator the C bralette bikini top, $85

The Investment Suit: Eres Les Essentiels Asia swimsuit, $470

The Summer Stripe: Solid & Striped the Elle button bikini top, $69

The Minimalist Pick: LSpace Balboa one-piece swimsuit, $183

The Cool Crinkle: Hunza G Bonnie seersucker bikini, $245

The Tropical Print: Agua by Agua Bendita tie-front printed recycled halterneck swimsuit, $290

The Party Starter: Oséree lumière colorè embellished bikini, $265

The Minimalist One-Piece: Haight Gabi and Mah stretch-crepe bandeau bikini, $238

The Playful Pattern: Frankies Bikinis Nick bikini top and Dove bottoms, $165

In preparation for sunny days at the beach and pool lounging, read on to discover the best swimsuit brands to bookmark and shop throughout the season.

Missoni Mare

Fans of Missoni’s colorful knitwear will also appreciate its playful swimsuits. Each style embodies the colorful patterns that the brand has become known for, plus they tout the Italian fashion house’s impeccable craftsmanship.

Lido

Practical swimsuits that are also sustainable need not be boring. Lido, which is named after the Venetian lagoon where the label was founded, infuses beautiful details into its Italian-made designs—like ombré prints and texture-creating ruching.

Tropic of C

Model Candice Swanepoel showcases her South African heritage and love for all things swim in her Tropic of C swimwear brand. The lineup includes sensual styles and a dedicated movement collection of swimsuits meant for proper swimming.

Hunza G

Minimalists will appreciate Hunza G’s sleek silhouettes. Ribbed fabrics add just enough detail, while rich, on-trend colorways make the timeless swimsuits feel like modern-day classics.

Agua by Agua Bendita

Heading to a tropical destination? Match the scenery with a vacation-ready print from Colombian label Agua by Agua Bendita. The brand gets bonus points for hiring local artisans to craft its swimsuits and for keeping sustainability at the forefront.

LSpace

For mix-and-match perfection, turn to Monica Wise’s label, LSpace. On the roster you’ll find minimalist staples that are made to move with your body during any water activities.

Eres

The quality and fit of swimsuits from French label Eres are unmatched. With more than 40 years under its belt, the brand has mastered the art of creating the perfect one-pieces and comfortable, functional bikinis.

Matteau

No fading trends here. Matteau focuses on designing timeless silhouettes, which is why so many celebs have gravitated toward the label’s minimalist creations, from Rosie Huntington-Whitely to Jennifer Lawrence.

Onia

For a seamless fit made with high-quality fabrics, turn to Onia—a swimsuit label by Carl Cunow and Nathan Romano. Its one-pieces and bikinis strike a perfect balance of being both playful and luxurious thanks to details like subtle ruffles and sleek pinstripes.

Haight

Here’s a label that creates swimsuits that are versatile enough to wear in and out of the pool. Pair either one of these stunning swimsuits with jeans or a maxiskirt and you’re ready to go from the beach to dinner. What’s even better? The latest collaboration with French model Tina Kunakey features adjustable-strap tops that offer more support and a customized fit.

Anemos

With an emphasis on minimalist designs, Los Angeles–based label Anemos has become a go-to for timeless swimwear. Since launching in 2018, the brand has expanded from one-pieces and bikinis to vacation-worthy midi-dresses, and it’s all created with sustainability remaining top of mind.

Zimmermann

From crocheted knits to romantic florals, Zimmermann has become the go-to brand for designs with sweet details. What’s even better? You can grab a dress to mix and match with its beloved swimsuits.

Bondi Born

Named after Sydney’s coastal town, this is the label to turn to for sculpting one-pieces and bikinis that are made from eco-friendly fabrics.

Louisa Ballou

Louisa Ballou’s eponymous line is a beach lover’s dream with prints inspired by the surf scene in her hometown of Charleston, South Carolina. Pick from fun one-piece suits or mesh dresses perfect for layering.

Jade Swim

Jade Swim proves that minimal doesn’t have to mean boring, with eye-catching one-shoulder designs, fine straps, and hypnotizing colors.

Solid & Striped

For more than a decade, Solid & Striped has created swimsuits in timeless silhouettes with modern details—like playful prints and ribbed textures.

Lemlem

With help from local artisans in Africa, Lemlem delivers a collection of classic styles that include vibrant prints perfect for any travel plans.

Frankies Bikinis

For effortlessly cool Malibu vibes, Frankies Bikinis is the place to go. Since its inception, the label has expanded into ready-to-wear and beauty products that embody a beach-going lifestyle.

Peony

Romance is at the heart of Peony’s swimsuit designs. From the sweet florals to the dainty bows, each creation has an undeniable femininity.

Lisa Marie Fernandez

Jet-set in style with a swimsuit from Lisa Marie Fernandez. The designs stand out and they fit like a glove thanks to bonded stretch fabrics and textured materials.

Marysia

You can spot Marysia’s beautiful swimsuits from a mile away thanks to the brand’s signature scallop-hem finishes.

Evarae

Here we have resortwear at its finest, thanks to Evarae’s consciously produced swimsuits, high-quality fabrics, and sleek designs.

Oséree

Here’s a label that believes beachwear should be glamorous. The shimmering two-pieces are the stars of its roster, but the brand’s cover-ups and accessories are equally stunning.

Cover Swim
